item.title: Joseph add a quote by Arthur Conan Doyle
item.description: "Mediocrity knows nothing higher than itself; but talent instantly recognizes genius." -- Arthur Conan Doyle

item.title: Joseph add a quote by Marcus Aurelius
item.description: "A noble man compares and estimates himself by an idea which is higher than himself; and a mean man, by one lower than himself. The one produces aspiration; the other ambition, which is the way in which a vulgar man aspires." -- Marcus Aurelius

item.title: Joseph add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "I count him braver who overcomes his desires than him who conquers his enemies, for the hardest victory is over self." -- Aristotle

item.title: Joseph add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "What saves a man is to take a step. Then another step." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Joseph add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "If the whole universe has no meaning, we should never have found out that it has no meaning: just as, if there were no light in the universe and therefore no creatures with eyes, we should never know it was dark. Dark would be without meaning." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Joseph add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Whoever fights monsters should see to it that in the process he does not become a monster. And if you gaze long enough into an abyss, the abyss will gaze back into you." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Joseph add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "A man is rich in proportion to the number of things which he can afford to let alone." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Joseph add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "This world is but a canvas for our imagination." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Joseph add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Every actual State is corrupt. Good men must not obey laws too well." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Joseph add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Joseph add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Joseph add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You don’t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.

item.title: Joseph add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I learned this, at least, by my experiment: that if one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Joseph add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I would rather sit on a pumpkin, and have it all to myself, than be crowded on a velvet cushion." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Joseph add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Joseph add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something." -- Plato

item.title: Joseph add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Music gives a soul to the universe, wings to the mind, flight to the imagination and life to everything." -- Plato

item.title: Joseph add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom." -- Aristotle

item.title: Joseph add a quote by Ira Glass
item.description: "Nobody tells this to people who are beginners, I wish someone told me. All of us who do creative work, we get into it because we have good taste. But there is this gap. For the first couple years you make stuff, it’s just not that good. It’s trying to be good, it has potential, but it’s not. But your taste, the thing that got you into the game, is still killer. And your taste is why your work disappoints you. A lot of people never get past this phase, they quit. Most people I know who do interesting, creative work went through years of this. We know our work doesn’t have this special thing that we want it to have. We all go through this. And if you are just starting out or you are still in this phase, you gotta know its normal and the most important thing you can do is do a lot of work. Put yourself on a deadline so that every week you will finish one story. It is only by going through a volume of work that you will close that gap, and your work will be as good as your ambitions. And I took longer to figure out how to do this than anyone I’ve ever met. It’s gonna take awhile. It’s normal to take awhile. You’ve just gotta fight your way through." -- Ira Glass
